rev.comment: at talk, seems like the neutrality of this section is what's at issue. if whoever added this tag disagrees with my moving it here, please feel free to move it back to the top if thats what you mean

Line 1: Line 1: â
{{POV|date=November 2011}}
+
[[File:OccupyUCD3.jpg|thumb|UC Davis Police officer Lieutenant John Pike uses pepper spray on Occupy demonstrators]]
[[File:OccupyUCD3.jpg|thumb|UC Davis Police officer Lieutenant John Pike uses pepper spray on Occupy demonstrators]]
'''Occupy UC Davis''' is an ongoing series of [[Occupy Movement]] demonstrations at [[UC Davis]]. It is distinguished from the off-campus but allied [[Occupy Davis]]. Occupy UC Davis gained international attention on November 18, when University police were filmed [[pepper-spray]]ing a group of peaceful demonstrators as they were seated on a sidewalk.<ref>CS Monitor [http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2011/1119/UC-Davis-pepper-spray-smear-tactics-Occupy-protests-face-rougher-response UC Davis Pepper-Sprays Protestors]</ref> Police officers claimed that demonstrators had surrounded them and that they used the pepper-spray in self-defense, however captured video of the event does not show any threat to the officers. In the wake of this response, at least one officer has been suspended and placed on administrative leave and a call to remove Chancellor Linda P.B. Katehi has been initiated.
'''Occupy UC Davis''' is an ongoing series of [[Occupy Movement]] demonstrations at [[UC Davis]]. It is distinguished from the off-campus but allied [[Occupy Davis]]. Occupy UC Davis gained international attention on November 18, when University police were filmed [[pepper-spray]]ing a group of peaceful demonstrators as they were seated on a sidewalk.<ref>CS Monitor [http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2011/1119/UC-Davis-pepper-spray-smear-tactics-Occupy-protests-face-rougher-response UC Davis Pepper-Sprays Protestors]</ref> Police officers claimed that demonstrators had surrounded them and that they used the pepper-spray in self-defense, however captured video of the event does not show any threat to the officers. In the wake of this response, at least one officer has been suspended and placed on administrative leave and a call to remove Chancellor Linda P.B. Katehi has been initiated.
Line 23: Line 23:
===Response to Occupy Cal beatings===
===Response to Occupy Cal beatings===
  +
The ACLU expressed "grave concerns" about the use of batons on protesters. The UC Student Association a statement saying
The ACLU expressed "grave concerns" about the use of batons on protesters. The UC Student Association a statement saying
"UC Students are outraged by the brutal tactics used by the UCPD against students." <ref>{{cite news|last=Applegate|first=Jamie|title=Reactions to the police response to Occupy Cal on Nov. 9|url=http://www.dailycal.org/2011/11/13/reactions-to-the-police-response-to-occupy-cal-on-nov-9/|accessdate=13 November 2011|newspaper=The Daily Californian|date=13 November 2011}}</ref>
"UC Students are outraged by the brutal tactics used by the UCPD against students." <ref>{{cite news|last=Applegate|first=Jamie|title=Reactions to the police response to Occupy Cal on Nov. 9|url=http://www.dailycal.org/2011/11/13/reactions-to-the-police-response-to-occupy-cal-on-nov-9/|accessdate=13 November 2011|newspaper=The Daily Californian|date=13 November 2011}}</ref>
